intro: Calochortus luteus, commonly known as the yellow mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow petals that resemble butterflies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its bulbs are adapted for storing nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Calochortus luteus is often found in coastal and inland regions, blooming in spring with vibrant, cup-shaped flowers.
